unittitle_ssm: Selligman Family Papers
abstract_ssm: Joseph Selligman, Jr. (1916-1937) served as a solider in the British division of the International Brigade during the Spanish Civil War. He died in early 1937 after receiving a head wound in the battle of Jarama. Following his death, his family collected documents relating to the Spanish Civil War and the circumstances surrounding his death. This collection contains a large volume of correspondence, including letters between Joseph Selligman Jr. and his family from 1933-1936 and letters among family members regarding the circumstances of his death. The collection also contains copies of Selligman's academic and personal writings from Swarthmore College.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
geogname_ssm: Spain -- History -- Civil War, 1936-1939 -- Personal narratives, American.
